[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Federal Spending Platform (FSP) defines requirements for managing financial data submissions, validations, and tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FSP supports data packaging, validation, error reporting, and integration with federal systems.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: FSP integrates with FPDS, FABS, and New Relic.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FSP provides web dashboards for agencies and auditors.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FSP operates on cloud servers and agency systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FSP links to validation tools and data loaders.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FSP ensures secure HTTPS-based API interactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: FSP optimizes processing for large datasets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FSP ensures 24/7 availability with scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FSP links to publishing tools for financial reporting.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FSP facilitates data submissions, validation, error tracking, and historical logs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: FSP serves agency staff, developers, and auditors.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: FSP depends on external data sources and secure authentication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: FSP requires compliance with government security and reporting standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Validation: Process ensuring compliance with schema rules.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with FPDS for data synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall link with FABS for submission validations.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall connect to SAM for DUNS validation.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow agencies to upload data files, validate them against schema rules, and log errors (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable users to download error reports and correct submissions.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage historical data, submission logs, and derivations (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard for submission tracking and error management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall validate data files within 10 seconds for files under 50MB.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 5,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store submission metadata securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track historical validations and data derivations.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with government data security standards and encrypt stored and transmitted data (TLS 1.3).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO standards for data management and security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control (RBAC).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure 99.9% uptime and secure API transactions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verification includes submission tracking, validation checks, and data synchronization tests.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Includes data processing workflows and compliance reports.
[SEC] 5. References: FPDS documentation, FABS guidelines, and SAM integration standards.
